pageTitle: German Elite League Hockey * English coverage of Germany's DEL Deutsche Eishockey Liga
textBeforeTable: (as of Feb 19, 2005) Leading DEL Scorers "Surprised": 3rd-round pick Thomas Greiss   Cologne/Munich, Germany  - 18-year-old goaltender Thomas Greiss was the only German player selected in this year's NHL Entry Draft. Check out what the San Jose Sharks draftee had to say after his selection.   Frank Johne San Jose draftee Thomas Greiss shares his thoughts on his selection "Motivation to work even harder" Juni 29, 2004; 01:32
textAfterTable: Q: Thomas, the San Jose Sharks selected you in the 3rd round of the NHL Entry Draft in Raleigh, N.C., this weekend. How did you follow the draft? A: I don't have access to the internet at the moment. I learned it from my mother who got a call from my agent. Q: Were you nervous? A: I actually wasn't too nervous. But the draft was on my mind all weekend. Q: Were you surprised that you were picked that early on, 94th overall? A: Absolutely. I did not expect to be picked before round 7. I'm very happy, of course. And I think it's somewhat of an appreciation of my efforts. Q: You actually missed a live television appearance on ESPN and TSN... A: Yes, the players picked in the first three rounds are presented on the podium with a team jersey and cap, and it's being broadcast all over North America. It
